messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 923- sunscreen
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/14/2006 5:13:36 P.M. Central Daylight Time, misty@felner.net writes: Last  summer when my dd was 18 mo. we had some issues, but only b/c
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/14/2006 5:13:36 P.M. Central Daylight Time,
misty@... writes:

Last summer when my dd was 18 mo. we had some issues, but only b/c she
wanted to do it herself. Once I resigned myself to letting her do that it
wasn't a problem. The waterBaby sunscreen that comes in a stick was helpful
for that. Towards the end of the summer we found the baby blanket sunscreen
it comes in a packet with towlettes or wipes full of sunscreen it makes it
very quick and easy to apply.


We just recently went to DisneyWorld and while we where there i discovered
the coppertone spray sunscreen. They make a kids one and all you do is spray
it on them. No rubbing no nothing just spray and go so quick and easy. I
would recommend this kind to anyone.

~Alyssa
Slightly crunchy, unschooling Mom to Landen(2 1/2) and Gage(7 months)

"Work like you don't need the money, love like you've never been hurt, and
dance like you do when nobody's watching."







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 923- sunscreen
messages.msgSnippet: Last summer when my dd was 18 mo. we had some issues, but only b/c she wanted to do it herself.  Once I resigned myself to letting her do that it wasn t a
messages.messageBody:
Last summer when my dd was 18 mo. we had some issues, but only b/c she
wanted to do it herself. Once I resigned myself to letting her do that it
wasn't a problem. The waterBaby sunscreen that comes in a stick was helpful
for that. Towards the end of the summer we found the baby blanket sunscreen
it comes in a packet with towlettes or wipes full of sunscreen it makes it
very quick and easy to apply.

Misty
